decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana with green devotion cards like Llanowar Elves and Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx, leading to early aggressive plays with Old-Growth Troll and Cavalier of Thorns. Kiora, Behemoth Beckoner provides card draw and ramp, while Storm the Festival allows for card advantage and searching for key creatures. The inclusion of Leyline of the Guildpact and Outcaster Trailblazer enhances the deck's synergy and efficiency in maintaining board presence and pressuring opponents. Oath of Nissa and Ulvenwald Oddity offer additional utility and versatility in various situations.

This deck focuses on utilizing cheap spells and looting effects to quickly fill the graveyards with Arclight Phoenixes, enabling their revival for repeated aggressive attacks. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Fiery Impulse and Spell Pierce to help clear the way for the Phoenixes to hit the opponent's life total. Ledger Shredder and Picklock Prankster provide additional graveyard synergy and card advantage. The inclusion of Hall of Storm Giants and Otawara, Soaring City can provide alternative win conditions if the Phoenix strategy is disrupted.

The deck focuses on assembling a combo involving Amalia Benavides Aguirre and Aetherflux Reservoir to generate a large amount of life gain and then use that life gain to drain the opponent's life total. The deck includes various ways to tutor for and protect the combo pieces, as well as cards that synergize with gaining life, such as Wildgrowth Walker and Prosperous Innkeeper. Additionally, there are cards like Chord of Calling and Collected Company to help find key pieces quickly and efficiently. This deck aims to quickly assemble its combo and win the game in a single explosive turn.

The main concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. It focuses on using efficient removal like Fatal Push and sacrificing creatures for value with cards like Priest of Forgotten Gods and Insidious Roots. Tyvar, Jubilant Brawler provides additional aggression while cards like Bloodsoaked Champion and Scrapheap Scrounger can return to the battlefield from the graveyard to maintain pressure. This deck aims to control the board early on and close out the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage provided by planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Narset, Parter of Veils. The inclusion of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion adds additional value to the deck. With a mix of control elements like Supreme Verdict and Dovin's Veto, along with utility lands like Castle Ardenvale and Castle Vantress, the deck aims to outlast opponents and dominate the late game. Memory Deluge and Day's Undoing provide card draw and deck manipulation to help maintain control and outplay opponents.

This deck revolves around utilizing Niv-Mizzet Reborn's ability to gain card advantage by tutoring for multicolored cards. The control aspect comes from removal spells like Lightning Helix and Vanishing Verse, as well as counterspells like Deadly Cover-Up. The companion, Yorion, Sky Nomad, allows for extra value with the flicker effect. The deck includes a mix of ramp, removal, and card draw spells to control the board and generate card advantage, all while building towards a win condition with powerful multicolored creatures like Omnath, Locus of Creation.
